If you use maven, you must add the jowidgets maven repo to your pom.xml

{{{ 
<properties>
    <jowidgets.version>0.0.2</jowidgets.version>
</properties>

<repositories>
    <repository>
	<id>jowidgets</id>
	<url>http://jowidgets.org/maven2/</url>
	<releases>
	   <enabled>true</enabled>
	</releases>
	<snapshots>
	   <enabled>true</enabled>
	</snapshots>
    </repository>
</repositories>
}}}

You may have the folowing dependencies in your poms:

{{{
<dependency>
    <groupId>org.jowidgets</groupId>
    <artifactId>org.jowidgets.tools</artifactId>
    <version>${jowidgets.version}</version>
</dependency>

<dependency>
    <groupId>org.jowidgets</groupId>
    <artifactId>org.jowidgets.impl</artifactId>
    <version>${jowidgets.version}</version>
</dependency>

<!-- use this dependency if you want to use the swing spi impl-->
<dependency>
    <groupId>org.jowidgets</groupId>
    <artifactId>org.jowidgets.spi.impl.swing</artifactId>
    <version>${jowidgets.version}</version>
</dependency>

<!-- use this dependency if you want to use the swt spi impl-->
<dependency>
    <groupId>org.jowidgets</groupId>
    <artifactId>org.jowidgets.spi.impl.swt</artifactId>
    <version>${jowidgets.version}</version>
</dependency>
}}}
